channel.title: How to run RSCAngel via LAN/Offline
channel.description:
* Table of Contents * * Introduction ** Requirements *** Downloading **** Compiling the server ***** Compiling the client ****** Database ******* Configuring ******** Running ********* Creating users ********** Troubleshooting * Introduction I decided I would write a simple tutorial on how to run the RSCAngel source code in a LAN/Offline environment. ** Requirements This guide assumes that you know how to compile java source code and setup MySQL/xamp, if you do not meet this requirement, please view other tutorials on this board to bring you up to this standard, it should only take you a max of 30 minutes. Please ensure your jdk is installed properly, your JAVA_HOME path is correct and you have apache ant installed (or the ability to compile using javac directly) *** Downloading First download the source code from here: http://rscangel.org/dev/rscangel_server_source.06.08.2010.tar.gz You will also need the client source code: http://rscangel.org/dev/client_src_svn.03.08.2010.tar.gz Winrar will be able to extract .tar.gz files, I suggest using this. **** Compiling the server *Edit [quote="darscape"]rsca.config.Config class needs to have [code]public static String MYSQL_DB = rsca;[/code] modified to whatever database the user needs.[/quote] Make sure to modify this file (src/rsca/config/Config.java) before compiling the server. Once you have the files extracted you will need to run either compile.sh if you're on Linux or make your own compile.bat on windows. If you're on windows, right click and create a new text file. Open the text file and put in the following, or your own commands: [code] ant compile pause [/code] Rename the file to compile.bat, ensuring that the file type changes from txt to bat. Now run the compile.bat file, if all goes well you will see something similar to the below:
Buildfile: build.xml compile: [delete] Deleting directory /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/build [mkdir] Created dir: /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/build [javac] Compiling 305 source files to /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/build [javac] Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. [javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. [javac] Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. [javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. [jar] Building jar: /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/rscd.jar BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 4 seconds
If you get:
Buildfile: build.xml compile: [delete] Deleting directory /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/build [mkdir] Created dir: /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/build [javac] Compiling 305 source files to /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/build [javac] /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/src/rsca/gs/model/Player.java:1940: cannot find symbol [javac] symbol : variable newItem [javac] location: class rsca.gs.model.Player [javac] newItem.setdroppedby(getUsernameHash()); [javac] ^ [javac] Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. [javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. [javac] Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. [javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. [javac] 1 error BUILD FAILED
That would be because I hadn't checked the source code before releasing :>. You can simply remove that line from Player.java as it was a failed attempt at changing my tradelogging system. ***** Compiling the client Extract the client archieve and then open the file: src\org\rscangel\client\util\Config.java You will need to change:
public static String SERVER_IP = "f2p.rscangel.org", CONF_DIR = System.getProperty("user.home") + File.separator + ".rsca", MEDIA_DIR = System.getProperty("user.home") + File.separator + ".rsca"; public static int SERVER_PORT = 43595, MOVIE_FPS = 5;
So that the PORT matches your world.xml port and the IP address is localhost (for the scope of this document). compile using either the compile.sh script:
export JAVA_HOME=/path/to/jdk ant compile
or make a compile.bat script:
set JAVA_HOME=C:\program files\jdk ant compile
You shouldn't have any problems compiling the source Once you have the rscd.jar file, open it in winzip and add in the lib folder and org/xmpull You will also need the data directory: http://rscangel.org/rsca.zip ****** Database Included with the server source is a schema for the database RSCAngel used, you will need to import this sql file. Via command line: mysql -u myuser -pmypass mydatabase < database_structure.sql If you're using phpmyadmin you will need to just import the file. You can go ahead and delete all of the rscd_ tables, there are lots of redundant tables in there which were used for the website, but I'm not going to go through and clean it up for you. The tables which the loginserver and gameserver use (Pets added a MySQL connector into the gameserver because he didn't want to interface with the LS (sigh)) are the rsca2_ tables. ******* Configuring You will need to configure the loginserver and gameserver configuration files before attempting to run the server. The loginserver uses the ls.conf file:
RSCD-LS Config localhost mydatabase myuser passhere localhost 34526 localhost 8186
* lsport and queryport can be changed to any available ports, providing you make sure to repeat the changes in the world.xml file. It is best to ALWAYS have the lsip as localhost regardless of if you're running a public server or not. The clients do not need to interface with the loginserver directly, allowing them to do so will open up huge bugs and exploits to your server. The gameserver uses the world.xml file:
- RSCD Config 39 localhost 43594 RSCAngel USA 800 3 localhost 34526 rsca passhere localhost
* Servernum should be higher than 2 as the loginserver is coded to only reset the online flag in the rsca2_players when loginserver 3 connects. This was a nasty hack at the beginning of the server which was never resolved. ******** Running The client: You can run the client with the following command "java -cp client.jar org.rscangel.client.mudclient" The server: Now that you have the server compiled and the database imported, you should be able to just go ahead and run the server. I normally use the java command when running the server, as ant creates two processes, itself and java. For Linux users, modify the included run_server.sh script:
cd /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/ cp runserver.log logsbackup/runserver.log.`date +%F.%s` cp logs/mod.log logsbackup/mod.log.`date +%F` nohup /home/java/jdk1.6.0_14/bin/java -Xms128m -Xmx2048m -classpath /home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/mina.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/pircbot.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/bsh.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/xpp3.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/slf4j.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/xstream.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/mysql-connector.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/lib/hex-string.jar:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/conf/server/quests:/home/rsca/F2P_RSCD/rscd.jar rsca.gs.Server world.xml p2p yes > runserver.log&
This will backup the log files into a logsbackup folder (you will need to create this folder). Also make sure to change all of the paths from rsca to your user and directories. The options on the command line are, 'mainclass serverconfigfile p2p/f2p launchIRCBOT(yes/no)'. The IRC bot's classes are in 'src/rsca/irc'. Not sure how complete the p2p/f2p switching is, we never really used it. For windows users: [code] set java_path=C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java set RSCD=C:\RSCD %java_path -Xms128m -Xmx2048m -classpath %RSCD\lib\mina.jar;%RSCD\lib\pircbot.jar;%RSCD\lib\bsh.jar;%RSCD\lib\xpp3.jar;%RSCD\lib\slf4j.jar;%RSCD\lib\xstream.jar;%RSCD\lib\mysql-connector.jar;%RSCD\lib\hex-string.jar;%RSCD\conf\server\quests;%RSCD\rscd.jar rsca.gs.Server world.xml p2p yes [/code] or [code] ant runserver [/code] Though I'm not sure if the buildfile has the correct parameters And for the login server, again Linux users can use the included run_ls.sh script and modify it accordingly. Windows users can use: [code] set java_path=C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java set RSCD=C:\RSCD %java_path -Xms56m -Xmx128m -classpath %RSCD\lib\mina.jar;%RSCD\lib\xpp3.jar;%RSCD\lib\slf4j.jar;%RSCD\lib\xstream.jar;%RSCD\lib\mysql-connector.jar;%RSCD\lib\hex-string.jar;%RSCD\rscd.jar rsca.ls.Server ls.conf [/code] or [code] ant runls [/code] (maybe). Linux users, remember to chmod +x *.sh before attempting to run the scripts. Make sure MySQL is running. Now run the loginserver first, followed by the gameserver if the loginserver runs without problems. ********* Creating users Here is the PHP code we used to create our users: [code] $universe = 1; if($universe == 1) { $utype = "rsca2"; } // Check that the username (or a too similar username) is not already registered $result = $db->query('SELECT username FROM '.$utype.'_players WHERE UPPER(username)=UPPER(\''.$db->escape($username).'\') OR UPPER(username)=UPPER(\''.$db->escape(preg_replace('/[^\w]/', '', $username)).'\') OR UPPER(username)=UPPER(\''.$db->escape(preg_replace('/\s\s+/', ' ', $username)).'\')') or error('Unable to fetch user info', __FILE__, __LINE__, $db->error()); if ($db->num_rows($result)) { $busy = $db->result($result); drawError($lang_register['Username dupe 1'].' '.pun_htmlspecialchars($busy).'. '.$lang_register['Username dupe 2'], "account"); } $result = $db->query('SELECT username FROM '.$utype.'_players WHERE user="'.$username_hash.'"') or error('Unable to fetch user info', __FILE__, __LINE__, $db->error()); if ($db->num_rows($result)) { $busy = $db->result($result); drawError($lang_register['Username dupe 1'].' '.pun_htmlspecialchars($busy).'. '.$lang_register['Username dupe 2'], "account"); } $db->query('INSERT INTO '.$utype.'_curstats(`user`) VALUES(\''.$db->escape($username_hash).'\')') or error('Unable to fill curstats', __FILE__, __LINE__, $db->error()); $db->query('INSERT INTO '.$utype.'_experience(`user`) VALUES(\''.$db->escape($username_hash).'\')') or error('Unable to fill experience', __FILE__, __LINE__, $db->error()); $db->query('INSERT INTO '.$utype.'_players(`user`, `username`, `owner`, `pass`, `creation_date`, `creation_ip`) VALUES(\''.$db->escape($username_hash).'\', \''.$db->escape($username).'\', \''.intval($pun_user['id']).'\', \''.md5($password1).'\', \''.time().'\', \''.get_remote_address().'\')') or error('Unable to fill players', __FILE__, __LINE__, $db->error()); if($utype == 2) { $db->query('INSERT INTO '.$utype."_invitems(`user`, `id`, `amount`, `wielded`, `slot`) VALUES ('".$db->escape($username_hash)."', '10', '1000', '0', '0'), ('".$db->escape($username_hash)."', '1263', '1', '0', '1'), ('".$db->escape($username_hash)."', '77', '1', '0', '2') ") or error('Unable to fill curstats', __FILE__, __LINE__, $db->error()); } [/code] But I'm pretty sure this is standard in RSCDv25 www files. ********** Troubleshooting If you encounter errors throughout this process, read the guide again. If you're still having problems, post them below and I will try and help. Let me know if I missed anything out here.

item.title: How to run RSCAngel via LAN/Offline
item.dc:creator: @Vicd Vicd
item.description:
@Vicd wrote:

I got the login server running fine, but the actual server does not start up.

Heres the Error:

Rscangel-runserver.png906×762

I’m using run_server.bat with this:

set java_path=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21 set RSCD=C:\RSCD %java_path -Xms128m -Xmx2048m -classpath %RSCD\lib\mina.jar;%RSCD\lib\pircbot.jar;%RSCD\lib\bsh.jar;%RSCD\lib\xpp3.jar;%RSCD\lib\slf4j.jar;%RSCD\lib\xstream.jar;%RSCD\lib\mysql-connector.jar;%RSCD\lib\hex-string.jar;%RSCD\conf\server\quests;%RSCD\rscd.jar rsca.gs.Server world.xml p2p yes

The java path is right.

item.title: How to run RSCAngel via LAN/Offline
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

Target ‘‘runserver’’ does not exist in the project ‘‘null’’.

I’ve completly buggered my paths up lately i think.

At the moment ive got.

User Varibles

ANT_PATH = C:\apache-ant-1.8.1\bin PATH = C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin

System Varibles

ANT_HOME = C:\apache-ant-1.8.1 JAVA_HOME = C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21 Path = %PATH%;%ANT_HOME%\bin

Does anyone have any idea which i’ve set wrong?

Cheers guys
